title: Why is Kelvin scale better than Celsius scale temperature? - Quora

response.answer_text: to me, the word ‘better’ in your question is not appropriate all temperature scales are equally good or bad it is more convenient to have a system in which the starting point is zero (the kelvin scale) rather than working in a system where you will have to routinely handle negative numbers (the Celsius scale) a more serious issue arises when you do algebra for thermodynamics. all calculations there are done in the language of “absolute temperature” where otherwise you will have to work with t+273

Only in physical calculations is the Kelvin scale better and it does depends on which scale you’re accustomed to. If you never learned about Celcius and only knew Kelvin, then you would say that ice freezes at 273deg K, rather than 0deg C. The Celcius scale’s only advantage is that we are used to it and it’s zero point is defined at the freezing point of water on Earth at sea level.
